div.p: Our school has chosen to administer the ACT as our test for the CCRA. We feel this is the best test for our students and the one that they are the most familiar with at this point. If you would like to comment in regard to this decision, feel free to email me at jkana@healdtonschools.org.

Our school has chosen to administer the ACT as our test for the CCRA. We feel this is the best test for our students and the one that they are the most familiar with at this point. If you would like to comment in regard to this decision, feel free to email me at jkana@healdtonschools.org.

div.class: custom_103260 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated 0

strong.font: 1 State Superintendent Leadership Advisory Team member
State Runner-up in Archery/ National Qualifier
Multiple Daily Ardmoreite Players of the Week
Multiple KXII/KTEN Student-Athletes of the Month

span.span: All-State/All-Star athletes in softball, basketball, baseball, track, and band
4 State Qualifiers in STAR Events through FCCLA
54 juniors/seniors out of 78 that participated in a post-secondary opportunity (tech, concurrent, internships) many leading to industry certifications
646 Community service hours served through various FCCLA projects and approximately $4500 raised/donated
850 cans of food donated by STUCO through its food drive and 66 blood donors through its blood drive
Every student in HES received a new toy for Christmas through our Toy Drive and donation efforts
Around 100 students were taken ice skating, to a basketball game, and to a Christmas play as part of HHS giving back to our students during Christmas
Around 25 coats were given out through our coat drive and donations
HES began a Student Leadership Team and raised over $1000 for heart awareness/ donated food baskets at Christmas
HMS STUCO donated canned food from its food drive during the holidays
80 students participate in our Food Bank/Backpack Program
HES offers two AR trips per year for students meeting point goals and 90% comprehension
Students-of-the-Month are recognized at each site
Over 500 students are served daily through our cafeteria and transportation department
Extra-curricular activities: Football, Cross Country, Fastpitch, Band, Choir, Basketball, Archery, Baseball, Track, Slowpitch, Powerlifting, FCCLA, Blue Crew, FCA and Cheer
Leadership Groups: STUCO, Beta Club, NHS, NTHS and Student Leadership Advisory

div.p: Click the link to access the school report card:http://www.oklaschools.com

span.span: Mission Statement

The mission of Healdton Public School is to offer all students a positive learning environment that will provide the foundation for their becoming happy, responsible citizens in an ever-changing global society.
Healdton Public Schools does not discriminate on the basis

of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, or disability or age in its programs or activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. Inquiries regarding this policy, please contact: Superintendent, PO BOX 490, 2763 Texas St, Healdton, OK 73438. (580)229-0566.
